alert.note: Alert for Inyo; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 6:27PM PDT until August 01 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN INYO AND SAN BERNARDINO COUNTIES... At 627 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dumont Dunes, Tecopa and Sr 127 Near Dumont Dunes. This includes the following roads... State Route 127 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 12 and 41, Excelsior Mine Road, and Old Spanish Trail Highway. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lovell Wash and Amargosa River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
